reviews.review_msg: Unclear grading schemes, boring lectures, cryptic emails. Teaches you very well about incompetency as he is a first class example in it.

No clue what any of the assignments want you to do and if you ask questions his answers are more cryptic than the original description. 

The only thing I learned 4 months and hundreds of dollars later is that technical writing is a required course to graduate. thanks

DON'T take this class with Dan. His assignments are unclear and he doesn't give you a guideline to refer to. His answers to any questions about the course and assignments are vague and he refuses to further elaborate them. His lectures are long and monotonous and every single student that I've talked to has admitted that they are bored of him.
Assignments are confusing and ambiguous and trying to decode his answers to questions are just as difficult
Avoid. Maybe you'll actually learn something with someone else. This guy doesn't even announce that he is not showing up to class and wastes our time.

Milan is the worst instructor Ive had in my entire life. Its amazing SFU keeps letting him teach. He teaches absolutely nothing all semester and just assigns work that is checked for completion then near the end of semester assigns toughly graded work and does not release grades from that work until after finals.
